summary: Congress sets a limit on federal borrowing, known as the debt limit. If the government reaches this limit and exhausts available cash, it risks missing payments on its debt, thereby defaulting. A default could have devastating effects on financial markets, the economy, and the United States' stature abroad. title: Debt Limit: Statutory Changes Could Avert the Risk of a Government Default and Its Potentially Severe Consequences
